definition: dried food (including dried fruits, mushrooms and seafoods such as shrimp and abalone)/(fig.) (coll.) knowledge presented in readily assimilable form/just what you want to know: no more, no less (no 水分[shui3 fen1])
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: Which one of the following statements is TRUE of the Baltic Dry Index?
sentences.chinese: 關於供羅的海乾貨係數下列哪個陳述是正確的？

sentences.english: After checking dry goods storage we went up to the frozen food storage.
sentences.chinese: 檢查完乾貨以後，我們又去了冷凍房去檢查。

sentences.english: In recent years Egypt has tried something similar with dry goods.
sentences.chinese: 近些年來，埃及在乾貨上嘗試相似的運作模式。

sentences.english: Organises the storage of dry goods and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 組織乾貨及蔬菜的儲存。

sentences.english: Di Huajie is concentrated north-south goods, dry goods all kinds of everything here.
sentences.chinese: 迪化街是南北貨集中點，這裏各式乾貨一應俱全。

definition: to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
gift given when visiting sb (esp. a local specialty brought back from one's travels, or a special product of one's own country taken overseas) (Tw)
(zoology) segment (of the body of a worm, centipede etc)/(fig.) a part of an integrated whole: aspect (of a project), element (of a policy), sector (of the economy), stage (of a process), etc
custom-made/made-to-order/to have something custom made/also written 定製|定制
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
